result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin A Lamarche was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Count 4

miscConds.notes:
Restitution may be determined at future hearing.
01/08/15 RESTITUTION WAS DETERMINED AT HEARING. Restitution for Waukesha Recycling ($9,272.84); Horning Middle School ($476.00); Sunset Bowl ($2,903.46) and Skateland ($10,192.52) to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with any businesses or victims listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Work toward maintaining employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 215 days were granted.

Collections may include income assignment.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/03/14 sentencing hearing.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court.   Defendant Colin A Lamarche did not appear.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review hearing regarding restitution.  Parties agree to restitution amounts (4 entities) in the amount of $22,844.82 broken down as follows:  $9,272.84 to Waukesha Recycling;  $476.00 to Horning Middle School;  $2,903.46 to Sunset Bowl;  $10,192.52 to Skateland.  Court sets restitution at $22,844.82 as requested and stipulated to by the parties.
Review hearing on January 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
character letter filed in court.

Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court, in custody, with attorney Anthony D Cotton. State gives sentencing recommendations. Victim M.H. makes statements. Atty Cotton makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant's mother makes statements. A. Behnke makes statements on behalf of the defendant. Defendant makes Statements. Court Sentences defendant to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

COUNT# 1:  ***CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #4***

10 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT 
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION: 5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed, sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions. 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain/work toward employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: business/victims listed in criminal complaint. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


RESTITUTION: Review hearing set, parties working toward agreement. 

COSTS:  $278.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

IMPOSED SENTENCE:

COUNT# 4:  ***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE***

10 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT 
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT (215 days credit)
  -  5 YEARS MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed, sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions. 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain/work toward employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: business/victims listed in criminal complaint. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____6 months compliance with Day Report Center immediately upon release. 

RESTITUTION: Review hearing set, parties working toward agreement. 

COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

  Review hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Colin A Lamarche in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 4.  Counts #2, 3 and 5 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Cotton requests a sentencing date. The state requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation. Bail is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
